wikipedia_page.main: Herbert Gardner Travers,  (1 April 1891 – 16 April 1958) was a British flying ace of the First World War, credited with five aerial victories. He later worked in civil aviation and returned to service during the Second World War.

response: | Victory shared with Herbert Travers and Francis Casey
| Victory shared with Flight Lieutenant Herbert Travers and Flight Sub-Lieutenant John Joseph Malone.
